metadata.description: Not used, but needed to pass arm-ttk test `Location-Should-Not-Be-Hardcoded`.  We instead use the `workspace-location` which is derived from the LA workspace
[concat('Region to deploy solution resources -- separate from location selection',parameters('location'))]
Workspace name for Log Analytics where Microsoft Sentinel is setup
Name of the custom connector, if you want to change the default name, make sure to use the same in all Elastic Search automation playbooks as well
Enter your Elastic Search url for example: ElasticServerNameORIPAddress:9200. Do NOT prefix with https:// or http:// etc

uiDefinition.description: The API Key for Elastic Search api
uiDefinition.tooltip: Provide your API Key starts with ApiKey <<Key Value>>

properties.description: [[concat('This connector helps to authenticate with ', parameters('CustomConnectorName'), ' elastic search andd running elastic search queries')]

info.title: ElasticSearch
info.description: Elastic Search connector that helps to search and retrieve data from elastic platform

get.description: Returns the indices and shards that a search request would be executed against.

metadata.description: Enter Name of the playbook. If you are fine with the default name ElasticSearch-EnrichIncident then leave the default value as it is

Enter your Elastic Search custom connector name. Make sure you have installed custom connector already. Default name is ElasticSearchCustomConnector. If you are fine with the default value, then leave the value as it is
Enter your Elastic Search Index Name. If you want to search across all indices then you can provide *

body.message:
Failed to Query Elastic Search - Got below error

@{body('Search_Shards')}

Compose_comment_message-_No_results_-_Ac.inputs: Account: @{items('For_each_Account_in_Entity')?['Name']} No match found from Elastic Search ----------------------------------------------------------------------

Compose_comment_message-_No_results_-_Fi.inputs: File Hash: @{items('For_each_FileHash_in_Entity')?['Value']} No match found from Elastic Search ----------------------------------------------------------------------

Compose_comment_message-_No_results_-_Ho.inputs: Host Name: @{items('For_each_Host_in_Entity')?['HostName']} No match found from Elastic Search ----------------------------------------------------------------------

Compose_comment_message-_No_results_-_IP.inputs: IP Address: @{items('For_each_IP_in_Entity')?['Address']} No match found from Elastic Search ----------------------------------------------------------------------

Compose_3.inputs:
Found below information from Elastic for @{items('For_each_IP_in_Entity')?['Address']}   (IP Address)  
----------------------------------------------------------------------
@{variables('empty_result_ips')}
--------------------

Terminate.description: This step is to FAIL the workflow and stop in case of any Auth failures or issues while querying

metadata.title: ElasticSearch-EnrichIncident
metadata.description: This playbook search in Elastic Search for based on the entities (Account, Host, IP, FileHash, URL) present result to Microsoft Sentinel incident
prerequisites: 1. Elastix Search Custom Connector needs to be deployed prior to the deployment of this playbook under the same subscription.
2. API key. To get API Key, login into your Elastic Search / Kibana instance dashboard and navigate to API Keys and generated key
postDeployment: 1. Once deployment is complete, you will need to authorize each connection.
2. Navigate to playbook --> API Connections --> Select connections one by one --> Edit API Connection --> (if required) Enter API key or credentials --> Save
